line_1: And homeward swam the milking pail;
line_2: And Evening wander'd through the dale,

line_1: And her sharp Nose hangs dropping o'er the Pail.
line_2: While their full Udders her broad Hands assail,

line_1: Elude my Hopes, and never fill the Pail;
line_2: And may my Cows distended Udders fail,

line_1: In healthy plight, to fill the copious pail;
line_2: My sheep be penn'd with safety in the dale;

line_1: When chaunts the milk-maid at her balmy pail,
line_2: And weary reapers whistle o'er the vale;

line_1: And throw it o'er the Pail.
line_2: And now there went a Tale,
And the sound of distant flail

line_1: Say, where his heifers load the smoaky pail?
line_2: Where tow'r his hills, where stretch his lengths of vale,

line_1: Each Morn I brought the heavy milking Pail:
line_2: Me once he met, 'twas when from yonder Vale,

line_1: But with distended Udders fill'd the Pail.
line_2: Nor did our Kine of milky Produce fail,
